description: Students further develop artistic, athletic technical skills in modern dance through
concentrated work on movement sequencing and dance conditioning. Students learn,
create, and perform movement patterns rich in attention toward actions and alignments of
the spine, spatial pathways, dynamics of time and energy, expression of weight/gravity,
andintricate foot and legwork. May be repeated with permission of instructor. Offered spring
semester.Prerequisite: two terms of DANCE 111 or permission of
instructor. Open to dance majors and other students with permission of instructor.
